DOC.brief_summary: Efficacy and safety of BI 1356 compared to placebo in patients with type 2 diabetes who have insufficient glycaemic control despite treatment with a sulfonylurea drug.
DOC.brief_title: Randomized, Double-blind (db), Placebo-controlled 18 Week Study of Linagliptin (BI 1356) in Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Insufficient Glycaemic Control on a Sulfonylurea Drug
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: Patients between 18 and 80 years old with type 2 diabetes and insufficient glycemic control [glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c 7% to 10%)] despite therapy with a sulfonylurea drug Exclusion criteria: Myocardial infarction,stroke or transient ischaemic attack in last 6 months Treatment with rosiglitazone, pioglitazone, GLP1 analogues, insulin or antiobesity drugs in the past 3 months Impaired hepatic function Severe renal impairment Current treatment with systemic steroids Change in thyroid hormone dosage Hereditary galactose intolerance
